Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: kjb2b
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay. We won our holiday for 4 to NYC & the hotel was picked & booked for us & we couldn't have chosen better ourselves! It is a small friendly hotel in the financial district. It's quiet at night but in easy walking distance to subway stations & South street seaport. It's also a heavily policed area because of being opposite the Federal reserve bank & minutes from the stock exchange, so it seems very safe! It's minutes walk to the 9/11 memorial & Battery park where you can catch the boat to Liberty & Ellis islands. It's a small & clean hotel. I can highly recommend the Federal cafe in the hotel. The food is great & the staff are friendly. The only downside was the free wifi which only worked intermittently for me. When we visit New York again we will definitely return to the holiday inn Wall street.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but Very CLEAN !!!”
Reviews.Author: GB12345
Reviews.Content: Staid there for one night during business meetings in NYC. Hotel is very small, but everything is very clean. Staff is very friendly. As Reward Points member, my check-in took not more than few minutes and check-out just took seconds! More meetings are coming up and I will stay there again! ...as long as price is right :-)

Reviews.Title: “Best front desk staff ever !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Frederico G
Reviews.Content: Just got back from NY .. Think all 2,3 or 4 stars in USA have almost the same rooms aspect.... But in that Hotel you'll find the BEST support and attention from the front desk people !! They are great ..all of them :) Recomend to all that wanna fell home !! Best for you guys. FRED BRAZIL

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johan D
Reviews.Content: We spend one week in NYC. Great hotel, close to metro and restaurants. Nice staff, special thanks to Ramona who served us breakfast at Federal Cafe all week and gave us many smiles. Would recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Thought I reserved 2 beds in 1 room... now I'm not so sure.”
Reviews.Author: UnlimitedArc
Reviews.Content: My friend and I plan to stay in this hotel in April. I booked a room through Hotels.com. The listing claimed a Standard Room with "2 Beds only" however, I received my reservation confirmation and it claims: Preferences*: Non-Smoking, 2 Beds Room details: This nonsmoking guestroom has 1 full-sized bed with triple sheeting. I guess it will be luck of the draw if I get a room with 2 beds. I suppose this is more of a complaint about Hotels.com posting misleading room descriptions. But I hope the Holiday Inn can be accommodating and provide me a room with two beds so my friend and I don't have to alternate sleeping on the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Small but served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: Rachel N
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and nice, however at first glance you can easily miss it. It almost has a "hole in the wall" feel to it. The lobby is quite small and when it gets busy, its really difficult to manouver in it. There there is no comp breakfast, the hotel has a restaurant that offers it (we did not eat there however). There is comp wi-fi and a coffee maker in the room, but the room is the smallest I HolidayInn room I have ever stayed at. As you open the front door, you are met with the bed and the dresser. The bathroom is quite tiny as well. It is within walking distance of Ground Zero, Ellis Island/Statue of Liberty, Southstreet Seaport, and Financial District. Not a bad stay overall

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Clara W
Reviews.Content: Though I stayed here on a visit to the City, this is most likely a business hotel. Still I couldn't have been happier with everything. Though the room was tiny, everything was new and clean, the staff was cheerful and helpful and the location could simply not have been better. It was interesting to be in the financial district, but with the subway entrance just a half block or so away, everything was easily accessible. There was nothing I would have changed. A great base for a wonderful three day stay in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, but good value”
Reviews.Author: Purduewriter91
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip in late January 2012. The hotel is really a good value at around $110/night and the location is perfect if you're doing business near Wall Street. The bed was very comfortable with nice linens. The shower was excellent with a waterfall shower head and lots of hot water. Internet worked great and is included with the room. The downside: The rooms are EXTREMELY small. I didn't eat at the restaurant, but bought a glass of wine at the bar. It is very small and certainly nothing fancy. $8 for a glass of cheap wine. All, in all, I would recommend this place for the value. It was clean, had a very comfortable bed and I felt safe. One night, there were some very loud people talking in the hallway after midnight. I called the front desk and the staff took care of it right away. I needed to print a document and they gave me an email address. The front desk printed my document, had it waiting for me with no charge! Who does that?

Reviews.Title: “Wall Street, New York, New York”
Reviews.Author: Sutton2006
Reviews.Content: This was a small hotel, but clean and handy to many areas. Just around the corner is the entrance to the Subway which for a couple of dollars takes you to Times Square. We caught the hop on hop off bus at Times Square and did the uptown and downtown tours (over 2 days). The fee covers both these tours and the Brooklyn by night tour, which unfortunately we didn't have time to do. Great value, very informative, get to see almost everything including Soho, Harlem, Greenwich Village etc. Easy to get off where you want to have a wander around or just get your bearings. Loved New York!! People were very friendly and helpful. So much to see and do.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Diego M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, near several subway stations and tourist places like the Ground Zero (WTC), Wall Street, the Bull, etc. The rooms are nice and clean, with new furniture. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfully, affordable stay”
Reviews.Author: Guy Z
Reviews.Content: For the price, I definitely cannot complain. I stayed here over MLK weekend. The lady that checked me in was super friendly and so was the door person. They were very responsive to all of my needs, and even allowed me to check in super early (around 11am). I was especially happy about that because I had woken up extremely early for my flight to LGA and really was hoping to rest. The hotel is in a convenient location (not necessarily my preferred location, but convenient). It's a block from the 9/11 memorial and a block from quite a few trains. It's also only a few blocks from the South Street Seaport. The room I received was much larger than I expected (given the reviews on this site). The bed was comfy. My only complaints are the lack of on demand movies and my room only had a shower and not bathtub. But really for what I paid I couldnt expect everything.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrottingLDN
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay via Priceline and paid £705.80 for five nights during Pride Week in June 2011 for a 2 double bed room. Beds were quite large for New York standards and very comfortable. When we checked in, we were offered to join the Holiday Inn rewards programme, which in return allowed us to check out late on departure. Staff were very friendly and accommodating with requests. We did go to the fitness room briefly, but this is just a small room with a cross trainer and a treadmill, which were difficult to use if you were over 6'1", as the ceiling was pretty low. The hotel also has a room with an icemachine and vending machines, which came in handy when mixing drinks in our room. The hotel is located in a very secure area, only a few blocks from Century 21 and Battery Park. The subway is around the corner, and has good links to both Midtown, Uptown and Brooklyn. There's a nice sushi restaurant around the corner, and as is standard in NYC, most places deliver for free. Overall, would say the beds were really the star of the hotel and would probably stay there again in the future. You're unlikely to find anywhere else that is as nice for the same price in summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a NYC visitor”
Reviews.Author: TheFunkyDuck
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a mixed business/pleasure trip and found it to be the perfect base for a NYC newcomer. My room was a little small, but certainly not too small and I think you get what you pay for, and then some. The rooms are veyr clean and tidy if a little chintzy, bur not gaudy. It was surprisingly quiet too, I had a great night sleep. The staff were very helpful and patient of my many questions of how to get here and there. I hope to return later in the year with my partner, I will definately return to the Wall Street Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place for the money”
Reviews.Author: IReviewer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights, King bed was very comforatble, large LCD TV, plenty of desk space. I paid $149.00 a night which is a great price for this area so I could certainly live with the smaller room size. Walking distance to the 911 memorial and the Freedom Tower under construction.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for NYC stay at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Kenyon H
Reviews.Content: I stay in a lot of NYC hotels, and I must say that even though this is small, it's a good value for the area. Right off Wall St, very convenient for anything downtown. If you need parking, they are contracted with lot around the corner who has a bunch of great guys working there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but very small”
Reviews.Author: Runnergirl89
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn with 8 of my friends. We got the first two rooms on Priceline, and when we checked in, they told us there were no rooms left with double beds. The long and the short of it is we ended up gettting another room for 2 nights, because there wasn't any way that we could sleep 4 or 5 people in a king room. It worked out fine in the end because with the 3rd room we obviously ended up with another bathroom. It takes 9 ladies a long time to get ready to go out in NYC!! The rooms were clean, but very small. I've stayed in a lot of hotels in the city and small rooms are normal, so it was expected. There were nice amenities, shampoo, conditioner and lotion in the bathrooms, and the towels were plentiful and soft. The linens on the bed were clean and the beds themselves were comfortable. If you have ever stayed in this area, you already know there isn't much action around. We usually end up booking near Wall Street because we get cheaper rooms, more money for shopping and eating. Century 21 is nearby, as well as Ground Zero. There are plenty of subway stations close in order to get to Times Square, Chinatown and Soho, which is where we spent most of our time. All in all, I have stayed in far worse hotels. You get what you pay for at this hotel in NYC. It's nothing fancy, but it's clean and relatively inexpensive for NY prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: TripTripersly
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and house keeping comes everyday to replenish towels, coffee, take out trash ect. and each night upon returning the room looks exactly the way it did when we first checked in. The hotel staff is friendly. I know using priceline.com sometimes your flight times will not correspond with hotel check in times but we were able to drop off luggage and continue with the day. I called the hotel later that day (before the 3 PM check in time) and requested a room on a higher floor if possible and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I would try to get a room on a higher floor if available (we were able to see the top of the 1 World Trade tower from our room) because there are buildings on every side and it looked like views on the lower floors might be limited. As far as amenities it was everything we needed. Coffee maker and free coffee, iron and ironing board, TV (basic cable and I think HBO), very comfortable bed, Heat/A/C unit below the window with a thermostat on the wall which is not annoying or creaky but makes a nice sound at night which helped me sleep and drowns out any outside noise, there is a vending and ice machine on the 2nd floor and a restaurant on the 1st floor (I didn't eat there so I won't comment on it but I know it was open early in the morning but closed when we returned around 11 PM). There are a couple of computers that you can stand up and use right by the elevators but I wouldn't expect to surf the web or anything. I guess they might come in handy if you forgot to print some tickets, itinerary or needed to check your email real quick. The area is very quiet at night and on the weekends which was fine with me (no outside noise, slept great) because you are a 2 minute walk from the Fulton Street subway station that gets you anywhere in the city at anytime of the day or night. There is also a 24 hr CVS right up the street if you need to pick up anything that you might have forgotten or might be prohibited to take on a plane. I enjoyed the area overall though. You are a very quick walk from Wall Street, Trinity Church, Federal Hall, World Trade Center Site ect. The only thing I would suggest is that if you are in Midtown you probably should eat or get food to bring back up there because after 9-10 PM a lot of the restaurants in close walking distance to the hotel are closed. There are a few places open but your selection is very limited. The bottom line is that it is a Holiday Inn, not the Plaza, so you shouldn't expect a ton of amenities but the area is safe, the rooms are clean and you will sleep good.

Reviews.Title: “i left happy”
Reviews.Author: jaredaggie
Reviews.Content: Decent location, frankly anywhere in Manhattan with decent subway access is fine for me. This place was very clean, very comfortable king bed, clean bathroom. Some folks mentioned the lack of office center, but I had to print off some ticekts in a huge hurry and their abbreviated business center allowed me to do so in a jiffy. The staff were friendly and answered any questions. No problems, and would be happy to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A basic hotel with noise”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2078
Reviews.Content: The positives: The location was good very close to Wall St. and the rooms are clean. The staff is friendly. Negatives: No business center but two computers with no chairs. The hotel is under construction or remodeling so there is a lot of noise. My room was right next to it, so the hammering and banging was the whole day! The hotel was fully booked so I guessed I had bad luck. Still, I felt that this room should not be booked during construction.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, not a great location”
Reviews.Author: RiverEddy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in December. And if you've been to NYC during Christmas, you know that rooms go for big bucks. I did get a good deal on this (named my own price at Priceline for $230 a night). I had never stayed this far downtown on previous trips to NYC. And I pretty much knew what to expect. But for those of you who don't know what I'm talking about or are thinking of staying here on your first trip to the city, let me lay a little knowledge out for you: This hotel is in the financial district, which basically means there is nothing going on at night on weekends. It's almost eerie to walk around NY and have everything be shuttered and closed. There are obviously pros and cons to this (pros: very quiet, cons, creepy and nothing to do). This hotel is close to Fulton St. subway stop, however, so you can easily travel to any other neighborhood in city. Room was nice and clean. Rest of hotel was just ok. Long and short of it: if you don't mind staying in Financial District, it's a good hotel. If you're looking for a little more action, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “New York is the place!”
Reviews.Author: QDaveGee
Reviews.Content: Downtown New York will you find this hotel, two minutes from Wall St and just five minutes walk to the 911 Memorial site. We stayed here celebrating our 40th Ruby Anniversary and was not dissappointed. Not as plush as some of the more expensive hotels but was clean and tidy with a very comfortable double bed, with all the facilities we required. We came back one day to find two Swans made from the feshly laundered towlels! Friendly staff who helped guide us to some of the sites in NYC with maps/guides to assist. The subway was particularly useful and excellent value often getting to Time Square and the Midtown sites in 15 minutes. You are also near the Seaport which is 15 minutes walk through the financial district where we chose a river tour for an hour to see all the iconic sites in Manahattan from a different perspective. We could walk to Little Italy and the Chinatown districts if your up for it but local transport is so good if not. The superlatives continue about 24 hour NYC and would recommend this hotel as a good base to be.

Reviews.Title: “Nothin' but the basics”
Reviews.Author: SammyNPaul
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip. I picked the hotel because it was right across from the conference. I booked a king room, but was given a standard. I was told that since I booked through hotels.com I had to take the issue up with them.I'm still waiting to hear back. I didn't have a shower curtain for 2 days-I called several times to request one. They even cleaned my room on the second day and still didn't give me a shower curtain. Room service is supposed to be available until 11pm but I called at 915 to place an order and was told that the kitchen is closed-which wasn't the worst thing since the menu wasn't that appetizing. All that being said, the hotel staff was great and the bed was very comfortable. The room was also very clean. There isn't much to do around this area and it's difficult to get a cab. It's basically a dead zone after 5pm, but it's a short cab ride to many restaurants and shopping options. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value at the weekend”
Reviews.Author: London_Andy
Reviews.Content: I needed somewhere to stay for a few nights in Manhattan and wasn't too fussy about location - given most hotels in New York are, if anything, more expensive at the weekend this seemed to be a good choice as, given its business location, it was a great price at the weekend ($130 + taxes per night on the IHG Friends & Family rate). The hotel is tall and narrow (20 stories, 5 rooms per floor) and you could easily walk by it without noticing, particularly given the scaffolding that is still up around it. I'd been staying in another hotel the night before so arrived at the appointed 3pm check-in time only to be told that there weren't rooms available - there seemed to be a few people in this situation and, as others have noted, the lobby is pretty small so by the time you have a few travellers with their luggage it gets a bit cramped! They took my luggage and I came back later, but the room still had to be "inspected" so another few minutes of waiting around. Taking one of the two elevators (never seemed to have a long wait, which was great) to the 18th floor I found the room to be absolutely fine - a bit on the small side but comfortable bed. It was good to have an iron and coffee making facilities in the room, and the free wi-fi (that other hotels are charging $15 for) was a real bonus, but a shame that there wasn't an in-room safe for passports etc.. The room was quiet, but with no views. It was generally clean, but there did seem to be an issue with the toilet plumbing which meant it wouldn't empty - not very pleasant :-( The hotel itself if just moments from Century 21 / J&R (shoppers' paradise!) and there are a good number of drug stores / fast food places / coffee shops within very easy reach. Whilst you have to get the subway to virtually everywhere, the good thing about the downtown location is the large number of subway lines very close to the hotel, including the A train to JFK. Overall, although the experience wasn't overwhelming I'd certainly stay there again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Good!!”
Reviews.Author: Lechu478
Reviews.Content: It was a nice experience for me and my husband. Very nice atmosphere. we love to stay in Holiday Inn!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: helenmarie166
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of the hotel and the service was great. The rooms are small but very comfortable and quiet. Overall I would recommend it and it for the price it is an amazing value!!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn 51 Nassau Street.”
Reviews.Author: Robert M
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive when I had read some of the reviews.Stayed there Thursday-Wednesday in late October 2011. A two double bedded room. My first visit to New York / America. On-line photos of it exaggerate the size somewhat; some sort of photographic technique I suppose. There was scaffolding up outside and building work in the area but that was no fault of the Hotel - just how it is. Found our stay enjoyable. All staff; front desk, restaurant and in-house domestic were friendly, courteous and efficient. Considered the room very clean and well serviced each day; yes there was not a lot of space but I go there to rest/sleep/shower and not party! Enjoyed the restaurant for a hearty breakfast each morning and occasional evening meal. A minor hiccup with a coffee machine in the room that didn't work but no problems once it was sorted, after a reminder. A pretty quiet area at night which was no bad thing; I guess Uptown would have been much noisier though more convenient to the action. I would recommend the Hotel without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: Stacy C
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is so tiny I walked right by it at first. The lobby is tiny - but how much time do you spend in the lobby? It's not the Ritz. The hallways are very narrow and when the cleaning staff parks their carts in front of the elevators it makes for an interesting exit. Our room was small but totally doable for 3 people. I didn't feel like we were tripping all over ourselves. It's NYC - how much time do you really spend in your room anyway? Not much if you're doing it right. TV worked. Free wi-fi was nice. Beds were clean and comfortable. We had a couple of service issues... One of the elevators was broken pretty much for the entire weekend. That left one really tiny elevator to service the entire hotel. Not fun. We were on the 8th floor and I took the stairs a few times b/c it was easier (and a good workout...oh and b/c I hate tiny crowded elevators :-). The other one was that housekeeping kept reducing the number of towels we got. We started off with 3 bath towels. The next day we were down to 2 and the bath mat was gone. Then we had 1. We called housekeeping to ask for more towels but they didn't answer. Front desk didn't seem to care much. They said they couldn't find the housekeeping person (maybe they were trapped in the broken elevator). I dried off after a shower with a face cloth I think.... Last service thing - when we were checking out, it was pouring. Front desk woman asked if we wanted her to get us a car. We said we just wanted a cab and she nodded and confirmed "just a cab". 10 min later the car service she called (not a cab) pulls up and tries to quote us $20 more than the usual cab fare to LGA. We told him to take a hike and got wet and just hailed one ourselves. It's not a bad place. Very close to major subway stations. Tribeca, Chinatown and the LES is walkable. But the service could use a little improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: City_Foodie
Reviews.Content: Room was small, but OK by NYC standards. Service was friendly, and efficient. Location is OK for subway access. Fitness room was useable. Bottom line, at the price I paid, I was very satisfied. I would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average stay”
Reviews.Author: OceanGem08
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a double room, which was incredibly cramped, but for Manhattan I dont think you could ask for much more - we got a good rate and booking was easy - booked on labour day weekend for the sunday night (booked on Saturday) and was pretty effortless. The bathroom was pretty average and the hand towel railing kept coming off the hooks, other than that the hotel was quite clean although the staff were not that friendly. Pretty average, but ok if you stopping in for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, excellent convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: Kayybee
Reviews.Content: Room witg terrace is awesome! Small rooms, but the location is excellent if you dont plab to spend much time inside.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, space is limited but sufficient....”
Reviews.Author: crg7Florida
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one night stay. Yes, the lobby, hallways, and rooms are small and narrow but the rooms were clean and served its purpose. I had a king bed room on the 15th floor and you are met with the bed immediately upon entering the room. However, there was still room to walk around and the room was clean. Good location in the financial district, one block off Broadway. There is a Starbucks on the corner and some food options nearby. Didn't eat at the restaurant so I can't comment on that. Overall, a good stay and would consider staying there again if i had to be in the financial district.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but sufficient”
Reviews.Author: ccdavis
Reviews.Content: When I read the reviews from others as 'small' I thought how small could it be. The rooms are barely big enough for the two double beds that are in them. Only one person can walk around at a time. The hallways are tiny, and the second floor appeared to be used at a vacuum cleaner storage room. We stayed two nights and the second night we could barely get by. (Since we were only staying two nights and leaving the next morning we did not complain). Though the room was small the beds and pillows were very comfortable. And seeing that we only needed our room to sleep in, the fact that it was small was not a big deal. Families with kids might want to choose a different hotel, so that the kids have freedom to move around. Location was good. A short walk from Battery Park, where you take the Liberty Island Ferry. Parking was in a nearby garage, just around the block.

Reviews.Title: “Do not trust this hotel, they are thieves!”
Reviews.Author: canapeta
Reviews.Content: I unfortunatly booked this hotel 2 months ago, I had to cancel my booking and did it 3 days in advence. Up to the hotel policy I could cancel without any charge up to 18:00 same day arrival. I was charged for a one night stay refundable deposit at the time of booking and after more than 2 months claiming I still havent my money back. I have reported my cancelation receip to the hotel mamager "Manish Chhatwal" hundreds of times and no answer till today. Now that I´ve checked some reviews I can see this is kind of their dayly practises. Because I work for an airline company me and my colleages travel quiet often to NY. From my part I´ll try none of my colleages book this hotel and so is my advice for anyone reading this review. It´s a waste of time trying to contact the "manager" Manish Chhatwal", you really feel rip-off and will never see your money back. Please, dont book this hotel, there´re plenty hotels in NY and this people are anything but thieves.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: luv_2_xlr8
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here multiple times over the past year for work and never had any issues. The rooms are clean and tidy, the location is in the center of everything (when you are there for business) and the staff are friendly and nice. Only downside is that its a really quite area at night specially if you need to grab a late dinner, but there are a handful of places open as long as your not picky. Other then that, great area for shopping and subways are close by to help venture out to Time Sqaure and other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was fine but the 3 stars are for TINY”
Reviews.Author: hardern
Reviews.Content: Was here for business and it was great walking distance to where I needed to be as well as within other sites. I read that the rooms were tiny, but the rooms are a lot smaller once you see them. The desk staff were very helpful, the room was clean, but finding somewhere for dinner was a challenge. The places were either packed with the after work crowd, or so empty that you were scared to eat there. I would go back if but might try other hotels in the area first.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely return next time in New York”
Reviews.Author: orak100
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel in a wonderful location. In the heart of the financial district with subway links to everywhere in New York. Just a walk to the ferries and South Street Seaport. Close to WTC and the PATH train across the river to Jersey. Staff were all marvellous, room and bed a very good size and the bathroom was excellent. I really cannot think of anything bad about this hotel. Even the bar serves some lovely beers and the bar staff very welcoming. We didn't try the food in the restaurant so cannot comment on that. But can thoroughly recommend Roxy's Diner for breakfast, just down a block and around the corner. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in New York for a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Neat, clean, safe, great location”
Reviews.Author: LibMc
Reviews.Content: Newly refurbished, small rooms - typical NYC!, staff helpful. Would stay again and recommend if you need a room in the financial district. single woman, felt safe walking in area late at night! Starbucks on corner! check out restaurants on Stone Street!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, great value”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaOutdoorsDiva
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights for a business conference. Sure, the rooms are small, but how much room do you need? This is an older hotel that has been nicely renovated. The price is reasonable and the location is close to restaurants and everything else in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but credit card charge error left bad taste”
Reviews.Author: Jane261596
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five days at this Hotel. Reception staff were friendly and courteous. On check in a preauth was taken from credit card for incidental charges of which there were none. We were told on check in room was prepaid and told on check out there were no charges. We arrived home after travelling for a further week in the States to find the hotel had charged our credit card for accommodation. Emailed with no reply. Phoned (after staying up to coincide with time difference) and reception confirmed we had been double charged but we would have to discuss with Kaye to have it refunded. Emailed again (twice) and were told that it had been refunded. On checking credit card statement discovered that the hotel had deducted yet another charge for accomodation and then deducted a further doube charge and refunded amount but after all transactions on credit card we are still out of pocket by $247. Now I have to chase the credit card as I am receiving no reply or acknowledgment of responsibility from the Hotel. Wish I had of read more of the reviews that mentioned similar credit card problems with this Hotel. It is a shame that this debarkle has soured our stay at the hotel which as I mentioned was quite comfortable. Chookas though to the restaurant staff and reception staff. Obviously the account department needs some staff changes.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the financial district”
Reviews.Author: UK_Yankee_fan
Reviews.Content: Arrived for a 2 day stay from the UK, at the start of a longer trip to the US, at 1pm and even though check in is not until 3pm my room was ready and allowed to check in. As a Priority Platinum was given an upgrade to a large room which for NY standards was of a good size. No problems with housekeeping or any of the staff and was made very welcome. This is not a hotel if you are looking for the bright lights close by on your first stay to NYC - but if you have stayed before, want to be in the fiancial district or dont mind travelling on the subway then this is a good choice with a variety of subway lines which will get you to nearly anywhere in the midtown area in anout 20mins. Also good for shopping as near to Century 21

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: behindthesewalls
Reviews.Content: For my second time, I was sleeping in new york city while visiting the city. I was here for visit the city with some of my friends. The location was alright. I mean, this is in the business district, so a lot of restaurants and shops are closing after 6 pm during the week days, but there's a lot of subway near the hotel. The room is small but, you're NYC and for the price is perfect, we were 4 in the rooms and it was ok. The room was in perfect condition, we didn't see any bedbugs or anything and I don't have any feedback for my friends, so everything was clean in the room. Great staff too, always available to answer a question... Also, you should check the indian restaurant just the next door to the hotel, really a good choice! For the price and for the location this is a great hotel... I didn't have the chance to try the restaurant so I can't help you with it. The internet works really well too.

Reviews.Title: “Aloof customer service seems not to care about your issues. Pity.”
Reviews.Author: njc264
Reviews.Content: Congrats Holiday Inn, you were so weird of a stay that I finally signed up for an account just to give a review of it. Now having worked in hospitality myself, in NYC as well, I know a thing or two about the "little things" to make sure the customers stay is happy and are accommodated. The Holiday Inn-Wall Street could've easily been a 5 star stay but they did their best to sabotage themselves. 1) - We arrived at 430pm to check into our room on a thursday to a crowded, surly group of customers ahead of us with their own problems, and seemingly uncaring staff of only 1 active worker at the desk engaging customers. Check-in begins at 3pm and yet there was still not one room available for us due to too many late check-outs. That is simply unacceptable and so easily remedied. 2) - We also had another group of 2 on our reservation who arrived on the red eye and was also denied a room for over 4 hours due to the over-selling of the hotel the previous night. They tried 3 different times to be moved to a room with a king size bed (as per the specs in our reservation) and each time were re-buffed and told to wait. On the third and final attempt the manager spoke to them and informed them they would be unable to be moved yet he could offer to sign them up for the holiday inn rewards program and give them a slew of points for a future stay. They declined as they have no plans to stay at another holiday inn any more. Based on my experience of working in a boutique NYC hotel, I can tell you without a doubt, that the reason my friends were not moved had nothing to do with the hotel's over booking, but their unwillingness to take that extra step. A self-inflicted wound that also, could've been so easily fixed if someone in upper management had seen this problem through. 3) - After our first night, we hung our large bath towels up on the rack planning to use them again. However they were inexplicably removed and NOT replaced. We got all our little teeny towels replenished, but not the ones that matter. I called down to the front office and informed them and the woman had replied she would have some sent up soon. After 2 hours, we got a knock on our door where a gentleman literally asked us if we were "sure" we still needed the large towels. Are you kidding me? We finally received our towels sometime during the evening when we were away. So much for having a shower before going out. 4) - On our last night, it was after 10pm and I wanted to know which, if any, pizza places nearby were still open. I called the front desk and the woman hurried me off the phone and told me she would call me back. She never did. This was the systemic customer service attitude that, once again, could have so easily been fixed. The good you ask? It was clean and next to the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to call 'base' for your NYC trip!”
Reviews.Author: JustAMom1
Reviews.Content: I haven't read any other reviews so don't know how much of what I have to say is a repeat.... This hotel is in a great location for a tourist -- at least 8 subway lines (2 stations) within a 5 minute walk!! Close to misc. restaurants (try both the restaurant in the hotel as well as The Diner a couple blocks down!) as well as carryout like Chipotle, Burger King, etc. CVS drugstore close by. Prices in this area are not outrageous, and this is the location for the huge discount store Century 21 :) It was so nice after being out and about in very busy, hectic touristy areas (Times Square, Rockefeller Center) to get back to the quietness of this area, at least on a weekend. Hotel set-up is unusual from what I'm used to, but perhaps not unusual for real estate in this area. My living room is larger than hotel lobby, and the 'business center' is stand-up only but gets the job done (printing boarding passes). We had an upper level, king room, and although rather small compared to other city holiday inn rooms, the rooms were very modern, including window treatments and wall-mounted tv. This Holiday Inn offers alot of the amenities one would expect (no spa though) including fitness center downstairs, arranged in a way that's different from other non NYC hotels I've stayed at -- but they get it all done and do it well :)

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: JenC7986
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay. The room was very clean and the staff was extremely accommodating. They were ready to help with anything I needed. I was scared of finding bed bugs, but the mattress and the entire room was immaculate. I needed a late check out and that was no problem as well. The "business center" isn't much. Two computers you have to stand to use in the hallway, but good if you need to print something quick. The wireless is a little slow. I had a great stay here overall.

Reviews.Title: “cant go wrong”
Reviews.Author: caponeskm
Reviews.Content: recently stayed at wall street holiday inn and was very impressed. got the room from priceline on a whim and was glad i did. the staff was great and the room very clean and comfortable . some odd shape room but had all the comforts of home. front desk staff was unbelievably helpful and friendly. even if i had to pay full price would be very happy to come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in the financial district”
Reviews.Author: AndrewBL1009
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at Marriotts when I travel, but this hotel was a nice change. It was convenient to where I needed to go for meetings and classes. Although, for some reason I was under the assumption that internet access was free, but being in New York City, I wasn't shocked when there was a charge. Overall, I wouldn't mind staying here again for business. I actually liked being away from the hustle and bustle of other areas.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: helcioconde
Reviews.Content: close to all metro lines, clean and safe hotel, friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay! Great price!”
Reviews.Author: AvidTraveler925
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous going to New York City and staying in a hotel, with all the recent media coverage of bed bugs and such. I had just had a bad stay at a Holiday Inn in Miami and was nervous about the stay here as well. They could not have been 2 more different hotels. Upon check in, the evening manager (I believe his name was Ken...I could be wrong) made us feel really welcome and a valued guest. We stayed in room 1501 and it was not large, but a great size for New York City. The biggest thing is that the room was exceedingly clean. The bathroom had been remodeled and was very nearly spotless. I have not had that experience at a hotel anywhere. The staff was great and helped with whatever we needed. They booked cars for us and more. I see a lot of people saying how small the rooms were, and I would not have expected a large room in New York City. The room was larger than I expected. Overall, this is one of the best hotel stays I have had ever.

Reviews.Title: “Large king room for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Rayrachz
Reviews.Content: I really loved the large king comer room!! I paid only $85.00 per night which is crazy for NYC!! The hotel was very clean! I also loved the bed!! I slept like a baby! The one negative was the location!! Downtown is like a gost town after 5!! One more thing the Starbucks right next to the hotel is closed on Sat and Sun! You have to walk a block or two up Nassua for one that's open!

Reviews.Title: “Standard Holiday Inn Experience”
Reviews.Author: FrankOhara
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn has recently re-launched their brand for the better in my opinion. This Holiday Inn was really great in my opinion. The staff at the front desk was very accommodating and made checking in easy. I was in town for a going away party for one of my fraternity brothers who is in the army and shipping off to the middle east. We arrived in two different groups, I was the one who made the reservation and I was in the second group to arrive. I called the hotel before arrival and let them know that my buddy would be checking in to one of the two rooms I had booked and they were very accommodating. The rooms were small-ish but that's pretty standard for NYC, but by no means were they cramped or too small. The rooms were clean and Housekeeping did a good job refreshing them. I only ate breakfast in the restaurant one morning and it was definitely good. The chef and server that were there are very friendly and service was quick and accurate. Other than that everything seemed to me as up to standards for the new re-launched Holiday Inn brand.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable experience!”
Reviews.Author: sjlighthouse
Reviews.Content: Arrived in NYC the day after the blizzard of 2010. Snow and cold outside but the friendly service at this hotel more than made up for any weather issues. The woman at the front desk, Elecktra Goodluck, was awesome! She did her best to accommodate our needs even calling a restaurant at 10pm to see if they were open (many restaurants either didn't open that day or closed early). The accommodations were extremely clean and comfortable. The rooms are not huge but were certainly ample since we didn't spend much time in the room. Oh, and the bed was very comfortable. I had the best night's sleep I've had in a while.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: ladya226
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Holiday Inn from 12/20/10-12/22/10. There was just the 2 of us and I had reserved a room with a king size bed. I couldn't have been more pleased with everything. The hotel itself...The staff was great! Very helpful and informative when we asked where things were and which subways we needed to take. Never acted bothered by the questions we had. One of them even called the night before we were going to check out to ask how our stay was. The airline lost one of our suitcases and had to deliver and the front desk called us and let us know when it came. There is a restaurant in the hotel. They have a fitness center and vending machines. Free internet access in the rooms (I had brought my lap top). There is even a computer with printer and internet access in the lobby area to use. The room itself was very clean. Of course with many of NYC hotel rooms it was on the smaller side. But it was a good size for just the two of us. Bed was very comfortable. We stayed in a room on the 19th floor with a great view!! The picture was the view from our room. When I made the reservation I was kind of concerned that it wasn't in the "mix" of everything (Times Square etc) but even that wasn't a problem. Everything we needed to go to was only a short subway stop away. There are plenty of things to walk to near by to eat. We ate breakfast at a good place right around the corner from the hotel. There was also a good Thai and also a good Chinese place right around the corner. There is also a CVS a few blocks away for anything else you may need. If I had to say anything I wish the hotel had it would be a fridge and microwave in the room. But even that being said I would most def. stay here again and recommend this hotel to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Very good although it is small”
Reviews.Author: Tonyyuan
Reviews.Content: The room is small. This is the only flaw. The service is excellent. Everything is clean. Also, the price is pretty good considering the location.

Reviews.Title: “Hotels you can find in New York”
Reviews.Author: chetiVenezia
Reviews.Content: If you are planning to stay in Manhattan , I don't suggest to stay at Holiday Inn Wall Street; rooms are very small and not clean; price is very high (our rate was 260US$ + taxes) considering the value they offer. There's no enough space to place your luggages in the room. Bathrooms are one of the smallest I've ever seen. Breakfast menu is absolutely poor; eggs , eggs, eggs....and eggs; ask muffin...you'll have eggs. No conciergie: internet is really in front (1mt maximum ) from the elevators . There are only two elevators for 20 floors, so expecially in the morning or late afternoon you need to be patient uf you want to go into your room.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Raquelita_BCN
Reviews.Content: considering the high prices in new york, this is excellent for value for money. great location, nice an clean rooms, helpful staff and free internet. only the restaurant would need some change. reccomandable 100%

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tolbiac75013
Reviews.Content: We initially booked a bedroom for 4. Even if I was aware the rooms were small, I based my choice on a misleading commentary left by someone here, which lead me to think the beds were not in the same room and that it was rather a suite. English not being my mother tongue might have played in this mistake. Despite of comfortable and large beds, the room was indeed too small for our 1 week stay. Moving around was not very easy, and getting stuff in our luggages was a bit tricky! We decided to take an additional bedroom so we could really enjoy our stay. The second room was relatively bigger than the first one. The staff was nice (for most of them, except for a lady who didn't seem to like her job...), everything was working fine, towels were clean. The location is great if you are a first timer in NYC. You're not far from the WTC, Battery Park, Stock Exchange. However, you figure out quickly that the heart of the city is downtown, and to get there, you either have to walk an hour at least, try to figure out how to use the NYC subway (I've taken a lot of public transportation lines over various countries and the NY Subway is the most complicated I've seen) or a cab. So here is my list of pros and cons: PRO *Comfortable rooms *Nice staff overall (the gentleman especially) *very quiet, even on week days *you can easily find something for a breakfast or quick dinner in the neighborhood *super fast lifts *not far from *some* major landmarks *super easy to catch a cab, even in the the small streets nearby CONS *dark (but that's the whole city) *we noticed a bit of dust from time to time and it seems that the room was not hovered frequently *inconvenient showers: you have to get through cold to get warm water, and half of it ends up outside of the shower! You therefore have to drop towers on the ground. The hotel would save money by installing a glassed wall, since all the towels used to sponge the water have to be changed! *it might be a cultural difference between Europeans and Americans, but I found disturbing to always find my bedroom fully lit up when returning. It's unnecessary and not very environment friendly (and I'm no tree hugger) *lack of foreign speaking staff. It was OK for me, since I get me understood in English or Spanish. However other members of my family didn't speak any word of English. If they had had to deal with the staff, I wonder how they would have done. But I don't blame the hotel itself, it's a general problem to NYC. NYers are always willing to help, we ended up lost in Washington Heights and someone even offered us to drive us (that was not a gypsy taxi or a limo driver).

Reviews.Title: “Warm and friendly stay”
Reviews.Author: rikkitex
Reviews.Content: This place was definately worth the price. Clean, comfortable and quiet. No excess frills, but all the comodities needed for our stay. Close to subways making it easy to get around the city. The staff was wonderful, Carlos, Elecktra, and Cayode were very hospitable and did their best to meet our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: eyesbluesh
Reviews.Content: I booked this room on Priceline and got it for 130.00 and was a little worried before arriving. However was pleaseantly surpirsed at how clean and new everything was. The staff was extremly helpful with everything, the subway was one block away, ground zero 2 blocks away and the financial district 2 blocks away. All sight seeing is within a 10 minute subway ride, which is worth every penny. The rooms are definately very small, but it has a king size bed (which is very clean and comfortable), and a TV and spent very limited time in the room. I would definately recommend this hotel if you want to save money on a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Least expensive acceptable hotel if you need a Wall Street location, dead center.”
Reviews.Author: TaktLosGatos
Reviews.Content: Room the width of a good TV, clean but no: closet, safe, refrigerator and only modestly quiet with view requiring you to keep window shades drawn. Breakfast acceptable, not included in room rates.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff . . . teeny tiny room.”
Reviews.Author: LivPhilly
Reviews.Content: Overall, I was pleased with my stay. Some positives and negatives: Positives: --Tiffany at the Front Desk was extremely helpful with directions and generally making us feel welcomed. --The room was spotless. --We stayed on the 19th (of 20) floors. The higher the better re outside noise that was minimal. --The manager phoned the room to see if our stay was acceptable. -- The location is good. This area is NOT midtown Mahattan - a good thing. -- Nassau runs parallel (one street over) to Broadway. You are in easy walking distance to Battery Park (ferry to Ellis Island- go early! 9:00 am or wait in lines that seem endless), strolling along the Hudson River towards Ground Zero - follow the grey brick path straight to the Winter Garden Bldg to view Ground Zero from this gorgeous glass building with shops and restaurants and outdoor seating by the river. --Dining - the area around Holiday Inn is packed with restaurants and coffee shops. Thai - Sage Cafe on John Street, Pearl Street Diner on Pearl, Plaza Deli for cofee and made to order breakfast sandwiches. --Subway access easy and plentiful. Negatives: --The staff can't do anything about the tiny rooms. Sparsely furnished. --Noise from elevators and hallway annoying. --No bathtub - only shower. --Lighting outside hotel is abysmal. Rather unwelcoming. Turn on some lights!

Reviews.Title: “Far from Midtown but close enough to subways....”
Reviews.Author: travels29
Reviews.Content: rooms very small but it's NYC, i expected it. the price was way too high but i understood why while i stayed there, the Marathon was going on! it is right around the corner from Ground Zero & Century 21, literally you turn the corner and it's in your face. subways were everwhere so transportation was not an issue. i've traveled to NYC many time so i didn't expect a big frill from this hotel i do have to say the customer service is AWESOME! Everyone was just above & beyond to provide excellent service and they were great! Tiffany was FABULOUS! the peron who came on after her on Sunday at 330 - RUDE. i would def do your research when you go and see what's going around in the city bc you can pay allot for a hotel in NYC! BC i'm going back in Jan & staying in Midtown and the hotel i booked is a 5 star & paid 1/2 for what i paid here.

Reviews.Title: “Frankly not worth staying here...”
Reviews.Author: stealthferret
Reviews.Content: I will bullet point to make this easier: - Jessica Davila, Manager, Indifferent to problems (see below). - No one at the desk when we arrived, eventually someone came out and checked us in, we went to the room only to find the key cards didnt work. Person on desk seemed indifferent, no apology, just re coded cards. - Hallway outside of room had miscellaneous dirt patches. - Room seemed grubby, no obvious dirt but just not very clean. - Woken at 7am every morning by housekeeping in the room next door banging, shovelling ice etc. made worse by them propping the door open. - No safe in room so had to take large amounts of cash out with us. - I have stayed in the Financial District before and this honestly isn't the better part. - Frequently returned to the hotel to find no one staffing the desk, walked by completely unchecked and went to the room. Elevators aren't key card type so anyone could wander in from the street. - We were due to see a baseball game but it had been raining and we wondered if it was cancelled. I called the front desk to ask if they could find out, I was informed in no uncertain terms that it WAS cancelled. Not that they THOUGHT it MIGHT be or that they honestly DIDN'T know which would be fine... Turns out the game wasn't cancelled, I was lucky enough to spot it online and made it in time for the 4th inning. - On penultimate day key cards stopped working again, apparently they had been coded for the wrong date. Again no apology just a quick re-code and 'there you go'. Upon checkout they said I had stayed an extra day, I managed to show that I hadn't and that it was paid for in advance. - This was the first part of a road trip around the US, unfortunately my girlfriends glasses has fallen beside the bed and were left behind. Hotel agreed to forward them on to us but it was at our cost, not too unreasonable (although we had spent over $1100 for the 4 night stay and are frequent HI customers) but I expected to be informed of the cost. The glasses arrived at our next hotel with no paperwork at all, we had to check the credit card to find it was a staggering $80+! For a small pair of glasses! Now the pricing is down to UPS, don't get me wrong, but had they had the courtesy to explain that the cost was going to be this high we would have just put the money towards a new pair. Given the amount we had spent, our frequent HI stays, priority club membership and the overall poor stay we had we emailed the hotel to say we were dissapointed they couldn't have passed the glasses on as a good will gesture or at least informed us that the postage would be so high. Our email received an indifferent reply from the manager Jessica Davila who seemed like she could care less since she has taken our money and we are unlikely to return even IF we liked the hotel... There are lots of good reviews on here, hence why I picked it, so feel free to take your chances. I would however, based on my experience, go somewhere else. (Oh, the WiFi was pretty good, connected easily on my iPhone)

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lulupho
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at plenty of Holiday Inns in my time and this one is the one that has guaranteed that I will never stay at one again. My sister's computer was stolen right from her room. The manager, Jessica Davila, provided what I would consider the worst customer service possible. Not only was she not helpful she actually tried to discourage us from reporting this incident to the police. She then went from being not helpful to just flat out rude and decided to blame my sister for her computer being stolen. People like Jessica Davila should not work in customer service. I will never ever stay in a Holiday Inn ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Manager & Thieves abound”
Reviews.Author: bills97
Reviews.Content: Stay here only if you want your stuff stolen and dealing with conniving management... My wife and I went to NYC in September and stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Wall Street. We came home after a long day exploring the city only to find that my laptop was missing from the room. I went to speak with the front desk and they said there were no reports of anything that night. They indicated the manager would contact us the next morning when she was in to take down our information to discuss what the next steps would be. Well, no call in the morning so I asked to speak with the manager who was Jessica Davila. She stated that there were no reports of any laptops in the lost & found..well yeah, because it wasn't lost, it was taken from our room. So she indicates she will file it to the insurance company and will get back to us when they complete the investigation. I indicated I want to file a police report and she reluctantly calls the police. The police tell us the hotel stated we left the door open which they feel is odd. Conveniently Jessica is gone for the weekend and we leave for home. I contact Jessica and confronted her about what she told the police. She stated that hotel staff noticed our room door was open.....this is new information as this was never disclosed to me while we were there. If it was open and the night staff knew about this, why did they not let us know when we returned to the hotel that night and in my original conversation with Jessica the morning after? Overall Jessica was conniving and not helpful as I had to do all the follow up. The hotel location was good but I definitely would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “What a find in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: ZitiSweetie
Reviews.Content: While I first thought this hotel would not be in the best location, the price was very reasonable, and I was pleasantly surprised to find so many wonderful things to do nearby and so many subway stops close at hand for exploring the rest of the city. We were walking distance to Tribeca which is loaded with so many wonderful restaurants--Locanda Verde and Trattoria Cinque, to name a few. We were only 2 subway stops away from the West Village where we dined at The Lion, a celebrity favorite which is even better than all the hype, and Morandi for brunch. The rooms at the hotel were spotless, and I wanted to take the bed home with me! Staff was friendly, courteous and extremely helpful. Truly a find all the way around in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, and friendly”
Reviews.Author: cmcdougs
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nothing special, but it is kept very clean, offers some nice amenities (free wi-fi), and the staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but are kept clean. It is in a safe, quiet area and has great access to the subway. It would not be good for a romantic getaway, but for business travelers or those who just want a clean place to sleep at night it's perfect. The area (financial district) is away from most tourist attractions and the night-life in Manhattan so it is a quiet place to sleep away from the honking and busy streets. Due to the hotels proximity to the Federal Reserve it is a very safe area. There are not many exceptional restaurants around but the hotel is right near access to the subway so it is not difficult to get wherever in the city you want to go. So in summary: it's not the most central place, but it's probably one of the quietest places you'll find in Manhattan to sleep; it's not big, but it's kept clean and provides all the things needed in a compact package; the staff is very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was booked and paid for on a no...”
Reviews.Author: Loopy1965
Reviews.Content: Hotel was booked and paid for on a no cancellation booking. 1 week later we were contacted by booking.com to be told the price was an error and the hotel were not willing to honour the price. They wanted an increase of 50% on the price we paid. After looking back at other reviews this is not the first time this has happened so steer clear of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: americaninswiss
Reviews.Content: Won this hotel on priceline and we weren’t disappointed. Rooms are small but they are very clean and the free wireless internet access is a real bonus! The location is close to many subway lines and lots of places to eat, especially take away foods and cafes. We often walked to Chinatown/Soho for food/shopping. Also, TKTS is just a short walk away—a great place to get cheaper musical tickets! Century 21 is just around the corner, great for clothing bargains. Found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. Nice priced hotel for this part of town.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to New York, glad we found this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: lanehring
Reviews.Content: I have to say, it's scary when you have never been to New York and want to book a hotel that is close to points of interest. Our daughter had a 10 wk internship in NY and we decided to come and spend some time here, see some sites and bring her back home.I was lucky enough to have her to ask if this hotel was in a good spot for hitting all the things we wanted to see. We couldn't have been happier! There is A LOT of walking in New York no matter where you are, but it was close to the subway stations. We only took 2 cabs, one to the hotel and one back to the port authority when we were going to leave, and we went to Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, Top of the Rock, NBC tour, Madame Tussauds, a broadway show, Museum of Natural History, BODIES, Central Park, Grimaldi's Pizzeria in Brooklyn, the WTC tour and SEVERAL other places.The room was wonderful, a little small, but it is NY. It was clean, modern and very quiet! We never heard any traffic, which totallly shocked us! The staff was very friendly and helpful. There was a problem with the TV and I think a guy was there to fix it almost before my husband hung up the phone to report it =O) Even though we were pretty tired every night from all our sight-seeing, we would usually walk to Battery Park in the evenings to relax and take in the awesome views. We highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again if we ever get back! ****** While this has nothing to do with the hotel, just a note. Please do watch your CC receipts at the attached, but separate entity restaurant, here is a waitress there that adds $5.00 tip after you sign, we had alreadly tipped her at the table.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience, better than the Grand Hyatt!”
Reviews.Author: chicagoshopper08
Reviews.Content: I spent my very first night in NYC at the Holiday Inn Wall Street, the staff was great, very friendly and helpful. The room looked brand new and was the perfect size for two people to sleep and be comfortable. Very close to Battery Park, Wall Street and WTC site. The remaining two night of our trip we stayed at the Grand Hyatt NYC, big disappointment, I would have rather been at this Holiday Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, great staff, and fantastic location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lynzo333
Reviews.Content: My mom and I are from Toronto and decided to go on a trip to New York City at the end of July 2010. This hotel was absolutely perfect for us. It was very clean, the staff was always friendly, and the location was safe and close to many attractions, such as the ferry to the statue of liberty, the World Trade Centre Site, and the great Century 21 Department (Discount) store!! There are also many coffee shops, restaurants, and take-out on the same block as the hotel. I would absolutely reccomend the Holiday Inn - Wall Street!!!

Reviews.Title: “No soap”
Reviews.Author: Gabriel_Priest
Reviews.Content: Checked in at 11pm to a pre-paid, reserved room at Holiday Inn Wall Street (Nassau Street), and was told there had been "an incident," and no room would be provided. We were instructed to walk with our luggage to Holiday Express "just a few blocks away." Told that someone was supposed to call us. No one had, of course. This time of night, no taxis, and no offer of assistance of any kind, either. We walked, with luggage, to Holiday Inn Express on Water Street and checked in there. Tiny room, airless, 81 degrees, no soap in the bathroom. Graceless. Called for soap. It was delivered, so I was able to wash my face. Asked if they knew where the rest of my party, with whom I have meetings in the morning, was staying. (All were booked at Nassau Street.) Was advised that they weren't staying at Water Street, beyond that, the night clerk could not say. The clock radio was also unset, and blinking, so maybe they had a recent power failure, or else they just don't care. I re-set it to the correct time to stop the blinking which was disturbing my ability to sleep. (FYI, free wireless, and it even worked, but unusually slow.) In summary: why would anyone want to stay in a hotel that handles them this way? Ever? Not me, and not you, I would think. No soap.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined my weekend celebration”
Reviews.Author: scl28970
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had booked a room at this hotel to celebrate my graduation from a doctoral program, so it was a really special weekend and we absolutely LOVE visiting Manhattan. Since the whole point of our visits to the city is to be IN the city and close to its amazing attractions, imagine our disappointment when we arrived at this hotel only to be told that our reservation had been changed, without ANY notice, to a hotel out at LaGuardia Airport. This was a totally unacceptable change in location, but since it was graduation weekend, we couldn't find another open room anywhere in Manhattan, and ended up having to waste over $400 on transportation costs to return home since we had nowhere else to stay. This expense and heartache could have been avoided if the hotel had simply contacted us in advance to tell us they could no longer accommodate us. Sadly, no one at the hotel took any responsibility for the oversight and we were forced to eat the cost of traveling back and forth from NYC for nothing. It was just a huge disappointment and the hotel did nothing to remedy the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: writergeek313
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Wall Street for one night last week. The queen-sized bed was very comfortable (with both firm and soft pillows, which was especially nice), and the daytime staff were all very friendly. The hotel was easy to find and conveniently located close to the A,C, E, 1, and 2 trains. The room was average-sized for NYC, as was the extremely small bathroom, but both were clean. There was a large flat-screen TV that looked nice, but I didn't watch TV while I was there. Unfortunately, the common areas (hallways, elevators, etc.) were extremely cramped and housekeeping carts are gigantic, so it was hard to get in and out without having to squeeze around a cart or wait for another elevator. There were two computers for guests to use on the first floor, but their location in the middle of a hallway made them both inconvenient and impractical if you wanted to use them for email or other sites where you'd want to make sure your password was safe. I never got the wifi to work, and I barely had a cell phone signal in my room. I really didn't like that there was no one at the front desk when I came in after midnight. It sounded like there were staff members in a room next to the front desk (and from what I overheard of their conversation, they weren't working), but the fact that no one was watching who came in and out at 1 a.m. was very unsettling. The hotel also doesn't require a key card in the elevator the way many hotels do. My requirements for a hotel in New York City are that it's clean and safe. This hotel met the first requirement but fell a bit short for me with the second. Overall, it worked for a quick trip, but I'd prefer to stay in a hotel that had better security at night next time.

Reviews.Title: “Untrustworthy in honoring reservation”
Reviews.Author: urban_traveler24
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night with a reservation. Although I had called to double check the reservation, when we arrived we were sent to a hotel near Times Square and placed in a tiny room for three of our five nights. Although management promised us a refund in writing, the hotel and Bookit.com have given us the run-around. It's an OK hotel but you could wind up anywhere in any quality facility.

Reviews.Title: “Service what...??!?!”
Reviews.Author: yetanothervacation
Reviews.Content: Going for the ICFF show in New York in May, we booked a triple room at Reserve Hotel. From the time of our booking until our departure for New York (flying in from Paris and Copenhagen) the hotel changed owner, and transformed itself into a Holiday Inn. With that they also completely mixed up all bookings leaving us with an email three days before arrival saying the hotel was now over-booked, but a room at another hotel at Times Square was booked for us. No such luck, though. Arriving in New York at 10 pm at the new hotel destination we were told there was no room for us, but we had to go back to Holiday inn Wall Street, where we arrived to find a room for two...! First the manager honestly suggested the three of us could just sleep in the same bed. And then went on to say they didn't have any other rooms - NOR any extra beds to put in the room. So yes, one of us had to sleep on the floor on a couple of duvets that we got under strong resistance from the manager, who really couldn't give a damn. No excuses, no nothing. The next day a new manager however provided us with a new room - for three - and with a few days of complementary breakfast. And a big excuse. And we did then have a somewhat agreeable stay... But... only to come home and following find the hotel - with no warnings or explanation - had withdrawn $250 on our credit card. And only when we asked why, we were told it was a fine for smoking in our room. Which is quite interesting as none of us smoke - and never have...! So right now we are in the process of talking to our lawyer to get the hotel refund the money, so no, I wouldn't really recommend Holiday Inn Wall Street...

Reviews.Title: “an alternative choice to midtown hotels”
Reviews.Author: manzana112
Reviews.Content: I spent 8 nights In the reserve hotel in new york. The hotel is at downtown, just between city hall and ground zero. Location is good and a main metro station just around the corner. the overall accomodation is nice, no frills no amenities no great problems. Rooms are small, the triple room was actually too small for 3, no place for the luggage at all, the just place another bed in a tiny double room.

Reviews.Title: “A nice change from midtown”
Reviews.Author: crackers123
Reviews.Content: Having been to NYC twice before we wanted to stay somewhere downtown rather than the usual midtown hotels and chose this hotel for it's location and price and we weren't disappointed on either. The taxi driver couldn't understand why we would want to stay in the finiancial district but I have to say he was wrong. The hotel is a two minute walk from several subway stations and broadway, just 5 minutes from Battery park (great to do the statue of liberty as you need to get there early to avoid queues) and was well served for restaurants and shops. We initially had one of the balcony rooms with a terrace which was lovely and then were moved to a top floor room (long story but not the hotels fault and they were very very very helpful!) which was also good. Both rooms were clean and well presented and the bathrooms were lovely with great showers. Beds were comfy and big. The lobby IS small but does that really mater when it's more of a place to sleep than a place to sit in a reception? The free wifi was great too. There is a good papa johns pizza right round the corner and a great chinese (number one chinese restaurant) a few blocks away who will deliver. There is a mini fitness centre which we didn't use but with all the walking of NYC who needs a gym?! All in all, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, clean rooms, good matresses”
Reviews.Author: tan0rexic
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay at the Hotel Reserve. I thoroughly recommend it. The location is superb. It's on the A train which means you can get to and from JFK for under $10 (including the $5 to you have to pay for the airport tram to the subway station). It is RIGHT beside Century 21, so perfect if you're hitting the shopping trail and is conveniently located for the Staten Island and Ellis Island ferries as well as the heliports. The price I got was far more competitive than any midtown/theatre district hotels. The aircon was slightly noisy so take ear plugs, but the room and bathroom was spotless and we had two large double beds for 2 of us. They replenish your bathroom with soap, shampoo, conditioner and shower gel daily so no need to take liquids if you're travelling hand luggage as we were. The staff were incredibly helpful and there's free wifi. Didn't eat there as so many cheap and good diners/restaurants near by. Definitely worth booking in here if you need a great Manhattan location with clean rooms and big beds. Every room has a 40 inch flat screen too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: travelmonk
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 3 night stay at the Holiday Inn Wall Street and we were really pleased with the hotel. We found a very good rate through booking.com as this hotel was just recently transformed into a Holiday Inn. Staff at reception was always friendly, check in and check out were fast and efficient. The room and bathroom were very clean, they had good towels and nice sheets, the bed was comfortable. There was free (and fast) wifi in the rooms and in the lobby there were 2 computers guests could use. A printer is connected to those, so you can print out your boarding pass or other helpful stuff. It was our first time staying in this area and we found it to be a perfect base for our trip. We walked to Chinatown and Soho ( about 30 mins) but all other parts of the city can be reached easily by the subway. There are a few subway stops near to the hotel but the nearest one is under construction at the moment ( you better check on weekends which station to use). We found some nice places to eat nearby and although quite a few of them are closed on the weekend, you'll always find something! All in all a perfect hotel for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: gem21
Reviews.Content: PROS: This little hotel is new and very clean. Free WiFi! Location is quiet at night, beds were comfortable ... all good for sleeping! Bathroom was immaculate. Had a booking snafu with Travelocity, but Curtis at the front desk took care of everything and was very pleasant to deal with. At the time of booking, this was the best deal I found ($175/night for room w/ two double beds), and I scoured the internet for deals! Other hotels at comparable prices were deemed "dumps" by TripAdvisor contributors. CONS: Space is very tight in the room and bathroom, though this is typical for a NYC hotel room. The faux-Aeron desk chair was in the way. We had breakfast the first morning there in the on-site restaurant -- slow service due to one wait person, expensive breakfast for something that was on par with IHOP (e.g., $9.95 omelet with toast and homefries). There are other options in the area, so don't bother. BOTTOM LINE: For the price, a really good value to stay in a new and very clean property. The location may be off the beaten path for some, but it's VERY convenient for the subway (Fulton St. station is steps away, and other lines within a few blocks). I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good Option”
Reviews.Author: DaveLIsa
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night, but can easily recommend this hotel. The reservation through Holiday Inn was in place upon arrival and my room was clean and ready. The room and bathroom were small, but manageable and, as I said, spotless. The "footprint" of the hotel is tiny so even though there are two public access internet terminals by the elevators in the lobby, the space is so confined, you can only stand to use the terminal- no chairs can fit. The staff was helpful and congenial, most particularly when storing my bag after checkout while I walked around for a while. The area is full of restaurants of all kinds - pizza, steak, asian, middle-eastern, mexican, diners, etc.- and close by several subway stations. Also nearby is all types of shopping, with the Century department store only two blocks away. If you only need a clean place to rest while taking on the city and don't need to be in the middle of Times Square, this is a fine choice.

Reviews.Title: “great value hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: bennip
Reviews.Content: I definitely recommend this hotel. It was great value in comparison to all the others that I saw when booking. It is now a Holiday Inn. If they keep their prices competitive then it is definitely worth booking.

Reviews.Title: “Travelled during a transition to Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: DNBursky73
Reviews.Content: It was weird staying at a hotel in transition. It was fairly smooth although I agree with the other person who stayed at the hotel at the same time. My only "beef" was that the cleaning lady didn't clean the room one of the 6 days I was there. It was the weekend, so who knows. I admit I slept in late. The front desk can get crazy and it's a tiny space but the staff are very professional and friendly. It rained 80% of my trip and I didn't even know how close the World Trade Center memorial museum is to the hotel. It is now called the Holiday Inn. David

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: questo
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I traveled to NYC over spring break and stayed in the Hotel Reserve. I was able to get a rate of $99 per night on bookit.com during one of their 48 hour sales. Room was small, but typical of NY hotel rooms. Bed was extremely comfortable and room and bathroom were clean and modern. Noise level wasn't bad, but you could hear some street traffic noise. We normally stay in Greenwich or midtown which I really prefer because of the location to shopping and the theater. The location is in the financial district, so when coming back from the theater at night, it is pretty desolate down there. We normally take the subway too and from the airport, but the train we needed to take was shut down for repairs. One of the hotel employees called a car for us to take us to the airport on a Saturday afternoon. The employee told us and guaranteed us that the fare would be a flat $65 (tolls included). My only complaint was that when we got to the airport, the driver told us that it was going to cost $75. I don't know if the hotel employee and the driver had a deal together, but I hate getting scammed and this felt like a scam to me.
